props.source:
This KPI Detail Widget is pointed at a single tag, which then displays the real-time value in a moving analog indicator to provide context of where the real-time value lies within a desired or expected range.

As long as the tag used with the widget is historized, sparkline trends will then be displayed showing 24 hour and 7 day history to show at a glance what's been happening recently with that particular KPI.

For each historical trend, we also display the minimum, maximum, and average values for the given time-period to provide further insight.

This Current & Voltage Widget displays current and voltage real-time values in moving analog indicators.

As long as the tags used with the widget are historized, trends will then be displayed showing 24 hour history to show at a glance what's been happening recently with the tags.

To use this widget for output current & voltages instead of input, you can simply alter the labels and point to different tags via the widget's parameters. Similarly, the labels above each moving analog indicator can be edited to reflect any designated current or voltage.

This widget is also used in the UPS Popup that you can view by clicking the UPS Popup button below.

These Input & Output Power Widgets display power values in a set of simple gauges.

The Input Power Widget displays values for Real power, power Factor, and power Frequency.

The Output Power Widget displays values for Real power, Reactive power, Apparent power, and power Factor.

These widgets are also used in the UPS Popup that you can view by clicking the UPS Popup button below.

Click this button to view the Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) Popup/Faceplate. This popup shows general status for the unit, input & output values for power, current, and voltages, as well as battery status details.

While this Perspective view is being used as a popup here, it could also be used as an embedded view within another view as a dedicated, always-visible faceplate to display the UPS details without needing to open a popup.

Click this button to view the Air Handling Unit (AHU) Popup/Faceplate. This popup shows general status for the unit, Cooling Fan, and Damper KPIs, along with key temperature values.

While this Perspective view is being used as a popup here, it could also be used as an embedded view within another view as a dedicated, always-visible faceplate to display the AHU details without needing to open a popup.

Click this button to view the Dynamic Popup. With this popup, you set a base tag folder path, which will then browse the tags within that folder, and display all of the sub tags, showing the tag name, real-time value, and engineering units.

For this example, the tag path is set to a single instance of a UPS UDT.
